newsitem.title: PERU: Peru announces major Inca ruin find.
newsitem.headline: Peru announces major Inca ruin find.

text.p: Peruvian archaeologists said on Friday they uncovered a major complex of ancient Incan ruins, including six mausoleums, on the fringe of the Amazon jungle.
At the site, called "Lake of the Condors", archaeologists found wall paintings, hundreds of funeral urns, ceramics, wooden carvings, crowns and weavings, the National Cultural Institute said.

The find in the northern Amazonas state, more than 9,000 feet (2,730 meters) above sea level and 12 hours on foot from the nearest town, was the most important Incan site discovered in the area for decades, said Peter Lerche, regional director of the cultural institute.
The Incan empire, which dominated the Andean region in the 13th century, was overwhelmed by the Spanish conquistadores in the 16th century.
